image_1.description: Charlotte's Web is a detailed, intricate web attached to a vertical surface, likely a tree or post, where Charlotte hangs head-down to think and work on her plan to save Wilbur. It is central to her place of thinking and working.

Wilbur is a small pig with a curly tail, standing on its hind legs and looking up towards Charlotte's web. He expresses concern about his situation, engages in philosophical discussions with Charlotte about life and death, and is the focus of Charlotte's plan to save him from being killed.

The Mouse is an animal standing on the ground, facing the pig Wilbur and appearing to be in conversation or interaction with it, contributing to the social dynamics and interactions among the animals in the story.

image_2.description: Charlotte is a character who weaves complex, radial webs and engages in philosophical discussions with Wilbur, also promising to help him avoid death. She is a large spider that Avery wants to capture, but is protected by Fern and Wilbur.

A complex, radial web with multiple strands extending outward from the center where the spider Charlotte is located. It is Charlotte's place of thinking and working, where she hangs head-down to think, and it is central to her plan to save Wilbur.

image_3.description: Avery Arable is a child who wanders into Zuckerman's yard with a live frog, causing a small crisis in the kitchen, and later enjoys swinging at Mr. Zuckerman's barn, which is known for having the best swing in the county.

Fern is a child who follows Avery into Zuckerman's yard, wearing a crown of daisies, helps with the frog crisis in the kitchen, and later enjoys swinging at Mr. Zuckerman's barn, showing concern for animals and trying to protect Charlotte the spider.

Mr. Zuckerman's Swing is a single long piece of heavy rope tied to the beam over the north doorway in Zuckerman's barn, known for being the best in the county, where Avery and Fern take turns swinging, enjoying the thrill of the activity.

Wilbur is a pig who is concerned about his well-being, follows Charlotte's advice to stay healthy and fit, and is saved from Avery's attempt to capture Charlotte the spider by the smell of a broken rotten egg.

Charlotte is a large spider that lives in a web in the barn, is almost captured by Avery but is saved by the smell of a broken rotten egg, and is determined to save Wilbur's life, showing patience and intelligence.

Zuckerman's Barn is the location of many events in the story, including the best swing in the county, where Avery and Fern take turns swinging, and where Charlotte's web is located, impacting the fate of Wilbur.

The Pasture is a location where the children pick wild raspberries after growing tired of swinging, and where the animals, including sheep, lambs, gander, goose, and seven goslings, come from, complaining about the smell of the rotten egg.
The Pigpen is the location where Wilbur the pig resides, and where Avery tries to capture Charlotte the spider before being driven away by the smell of a broken rotten egg.

image_4.description: A young boy with curly hair, wearing a striped shirt and shorts, lying on his back with his legs in the air, who is also known as Avery in the story and initially wants to capture a spider named Charlotte.
A tree stump with a broken branch, located near the boy's head, and is part of the setting in the barn where many events take place.
Patch of grass where the boy is lying, and is part of the barn's environment where the events unfold.
A broken branch from the tree stump, lying across the boy's body, which is also part of the scene in the barn.

image_5.description: A detailed, intricate web with a central hub and radiating spokes, set against a dark background, where Charlotte, a spider, weaves messages that impact the fate of Wilbur, prominently displayed in the doorway of the barn cellar, right over the pigpen.

Lurvy is a character and the hired man working for the Zuckerman family, responsible for feeding Wilbur the pig. He discovers a message on a spider's web and calls Mr. Zuckerman to come see it, reacting strongly to the奇迹 on the farm.

Mr. Zuckerman is the person Lurvy calls to come see the message on the spider's web, and he is married to Mrs. Zuckerman. He is the husband of Edith and one of the few people who know about the miracle on the farm.
Wilbur is the pig that the message 'Some Pig' is referring to, and he receives a lot of attention from the Zuckermans and Lurvy. He is the center of attention due to the奇迹 on the Zuckerman farm.

Zuckerman's Farm is the location where the events take place, including the discovery of the message on the spider's web and Wilbur's pigpen. It is also known as the place where the miracle occurred, attracting attention to Wilbur.

image_7.description: Zuckerman's Farm is the location where the events take place, including the discovery of the message on the spider's web and Wilbur's pigpen, with a white background contrasting with the black letter 'O'.

image_8.description: Charlotte is a spider who weaves messages in her web, drawing attention to Wilbur and is central to the events in the barn cellar. She is an expert at weaving and uses her eight legs and teeth to create her web. She is also responsible for organizing a meeting and is responsible for writing messages in her web to save Wilbur's life.

Wilbur is a pig that is the center of attention due to the miracle on the Zuckerman farm. He is the pig whose life is in danger but is being saved by Charlotte's messages in her web. Wilbur is also described as feeling terrific and is the center of attention due to the messages in Charlotte's web.

The sheep are part of the animal community in the barn cellar, responding to Charlotte's roll call during the meeting. They are also a group of animals that participate in the meeting and contribute to the discussion about saving Wilbur. The lambs, the young sheep, also participate in the meeting and suggest slogans for Charlotte's web.

The ducks are gathered near the water, some are swimming and others are standing. They are also mentioned as a group of animals that participate in the meeting and suggest slogans for Charlotte's web.
A wooden fence that separates the girl from the animals. It is also the location where Wilbur resides and where Charlotte weaves her messages.

The Zuckerman family owns the farm where the events take place, and they are responsible for the care of Wilbur, the pig. Mr. Zuckerman is the owner of the pig and decides to take Wilbur to the County Fair. Mrs. Zuckerman is involved in spreading the news about Wilbur being 'terrific'.

Templeton is the rat who is initially absent during Charlotte's roll call in the meeting of the animals. He is a rat who is initially reluctant to help but is convinced to assist Charlotte by finding magazine clippings for new messages. Templeton is also known as the Rat and is known for looking out for himself and is convinced to help Charlotte.

The barn cellar is the location where the animals gather for the meeting called by Charlotte. It is also where Charlotte and the other animals gather and where Templeton can bring magazine clippings. The barn cellar is where Charlotte can be heard talking to herself while working on her web.

image_9.description: Charlotte is a spider who weaves messages in her web and is an expert at it. She uses her eight legs and teeth to create a circular web with concentric circles and radial lines. Charlotte is responsible for writing messages in her web to save Wilbur's life, and she loves to weave.

The web is Charlotte's medium for writing messages that influence the perception of Wilbur and is central to the story. It is a circular web with concentric circles and radial lines, created by the spider. Charlotte uses different types of threads for foundation lines and snare lines to catch insects.

image_10.description: Wilbur is a pig who feels terrific and is the center of attention due to the messages in Charlotte's web. He is standing near a wooden post and a spider web.

The Web is Charlotte's medium for writing messages that influence the perception of Wilbur and is central to the story. It is a large spider web with the word 'TERRIFIC' woven into it, attached to a wooden post.
A tall wooden post standing next to the pig, supporting the spider web where Charlotte weaves her messages.

Terrific is the final slogan chosen by Charlotte for her web, which she believes will impress Zuckerman. It is woven into the spider web and is seen by Wilbur, Zuckerman, and others, leading to Wilbur being recognized as terrific.

image_11.description: Templeton is a rat who scavenges the dump for useful items and interacts with Charlotte and Wilbur. He is also seen standing on his hind legs, appearing to be eating or interacting with a piece of bread that has the word 'CRUNCHY' written on it.

A piece of bread with the word 'CRUNCHY' written on it, being held by the rat Templeton, which is suggested as an advertising material for Charlotte's web but is rejected as it implies Wilbur's tastiness.

The dump is a location on the Zuckerman farm where various trash and unwanted items are discarded, including a wrong-size crank for a broken ice-cream freezer. It is a place where Templeton finds items, including advertising materials for Charlotte, and is surrounded by young alders and wild raspberry bushes.

image_12.description: The pigpen is the location where Wilbur resides and where Charlotte weaves her messages, depicted as a small clearing with grass and soil beneath the pig.

image_13.description: Charlotte is a character who communicates with Wilbur and Templeton, providing guidance and suggestions. She is also depicted as actively weaving a web over the water in the image, with her body detailed with segments and legs engaged in web construction.

The web is a structure built by Charlotte's cousin across a stream, where she caught a fish, as told in one of Charlotte's stories. It is also shown in the image as intricately drawn, spanning across the water and connecting to the grass on either side, in the process of being woven by the spider.

The stream is a geographical feature mentioned in the story where Charlotte's cousin built her web. It is also shown in the image as a calm body of water beneath the spider and its web, with ripples visible on the surface, indicating the disturbance caused by the spider's activity.

Tall blades of grass are illustrated on both sides of the water in the image, providing a natural setting for the scene. The grass is depicted as bending slightly, possibly due to a breeze or the weight of the web. It is also mentioned in the narrative, chirping in the grass while Charlotte sings a lullaby.

image_14.description: Fern is an eight-year-old girl who loves animals and spends time in Homer Zuckerman's barn cellar. She is depicted in the image as a young girl with her hair tied up, wearing a necklace and a hat, sitting in an armchair, holding a doll.

The Zuckermans' barn is a location where Fern spends time watching animals. In the image, the barn is implied as the setting where the armchair is located, and it is a place that isn't lonely for Fern as she has her best friends there.

The doll being held by Fern in the image is dressed in detailed clothing. In the narrative, Fern's love for animals extends to her toys, as she is depicted holding this doll, which could symbolize her affection and care for creatures, including those in the Zuckermans' barn.

image_15.description: Dr. Dorian is a doctor with a thick beard, who Mrs. Arable consults for advice regarding Fern's behavior and provides insights on the miraculous nature of spiders' webs and animals' communication.
Fern is an eight-year-old girl who loves animals and spends time in Homer Zuckerman's barn cellar, particularly interested in a pig named Wilbur.
Wilbur is a pig that Fern raised and has a special connection with, spending time with at Zuckermans' barn.
Charlotte is a spider who befriends Wilbur and helps him gain a positive reputation by creating webs with words.
The Zuckermans' barn is a location where Fern spends time watching animals, including Wilbur, and is the site of the miraculous words in the spider's web.
Pigpen is the location in the barn where Fern spends a lot of her time, near the animals she cares for, including Wilbur.
The spider's web is the location where the miraculous words appeared, sparking curiosity and wonder among the characters, and is associated with Charlotte.

image_16.description: Wilbur is a pig on the farm who becomes the center of attraction and is friends with Charlotte. He is also known as 'Zuckerman's Famous Pig' and is being showcased at the County Fair with high expectations, hoping to win a prize and secure his future.

Charlotte is a spider who befriends Wilbur and helps him gain a positive reputation. She is initially reluctant to attend the County Fair due to her responsibilities, such as laying eggs, but later decides to accompany Wilbur, believing her writing skills may be necessary.

The County Fair is an upcoming event that Wilbur is looking forward to attending, hoping to win a prize and secure his future. It is also an event where a group of people, including a crowd and several tents, are gathered, likely part of the fair or exhibition.

Zuckerman is a character who has control over Wilbur's living situation and is impressed by Wilbur's potential success at the County Fair. He is also known as Mr. Zuckerman and is involved in discussions about Wilbur's preparation for the County Fair.
Lurvy is a worker on the farm who builds a crate for Wilbur and digs potatoes. He is also mentioned in the context of feeding Wilbur, which results in the pig getting dirty.

A tree located to the left of the pig, providing some natural scenery. It is part of the setting on the farm where the story takes place, home to various animals and characters, including Wilbur and Charlotte.

image_17.description: Wilbur is a large pig being petted by the woman and is also referred to as 'Zuckerman's Famous Pig'. He is being prepared for the County Fair by Mrs. Zuckerman, who gives him a buttermilk bath to clean him.

Mrs. Zuckerman is a character who decides to give Wilbur a buttermilk bath before the County Fair. She is also known as Edith and is actively involved in cleaning Wilbur, wearing rubber boots and an old raincoat for the task.
Mr. Zuckerman is a character who discusses Wilbur's cleanliness with Mrs. Zuckerman before the County Fair and takes pride in the cleanliness of his pig, Wilbur. He is also known as Homer.
The buttermilk bath is an event where Mrs. Zuckerman decides to bathe Wilbur with buttermilk before the County Fair, using a bucket of buttermilk and a small wooden paddle.

The County Fair is an event that Wilbur is looking forward to attending, hoping to win prize money and impress Zuckerman. It is a significant point of discussion among the characters and is the central event where the preparations and expectations are focused.
